channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report E-2023100174
item.description:
Report E-2023100174

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one case of denatured alcohol (un1987) damaging one of the inner metal 1 gallon can and releasing 1 gallon of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023090651
item.description:
Report X-2023090651

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The leaking package was removed from sort, placed in a lined tote, and brought to the HMPA for processing. DescribePack: The bottle leaked at the cap. Less than two ounces were lost. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a lined tote and brought to the HMPA. The leakage was confined to the carton itself.

item.title: Report X-2023090627
item.description:
Report X-2023090627

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-11
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Visibly undamaged fiberboard box found stopped on loadside after EBIR (discovery location) attempted applying 97/RTS/DOT-SP 14823 for "Expired Hold." Certification requested from origin and then shipper; package found compliant. Mild solvent-like odor emanating from box; upon transfer to HMPA and further investigation, it was found that one of four inner jerricans weighed 4.4lb when the other three jerricans weighed consistently 6.8lb. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon metal jerricans lost 0.35gal from closure due to severe denting that disrupted the seal between container and lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation utilized.

item.title: Report X-2023090616
item.description:
Report X-2023090616

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: MOUNT JULIET
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND WET/CORRODED UNDER THE BELT AFTER DISPATCH. PACKAGE WAS MOVED TO A HAZMAT TOTE AND TAKEN TO QA DAMAGE AREA. DescribePack: TWO OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAVE DAMAGED/BROKEN CAPS DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE MOVED TO HAZMAT TOTE AND PLACED IN CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2023090611
item.description:
Report X-2023090611

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Plastic pail found in lined tote placed on HMPA staging pallet by unknown entity. Prior spill events unchronicled; loadside scans were applied prior to spill/transport to HMPA. DescribePack: Drum with removable lid lost 0.2LB of solid Sodium Hydroxide caustic powder. No holes were found but spillage was consistently splattered directly below lid closure and also coated handle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation used. Appropriate liner used in protecting tote.

item.title: Report X-2023090576
item.description:
Report X-2023090576

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: box was being moved from unload when the bottom closures opened causing the contents to fall onto the floor. DescribePack: the glue holding the bottom flaps together failed DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: using latex gloves, the damaged box was put in a plastic black tote and was sent the HazMat cage for further investigation..

item.title: Report X-2023090541
item.description:
Report X-2023090541

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It has been brought to our attention that a plastic pail was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the pail was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. DescribePack: A Plastic pail experienced leakage due to a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the package's leakage, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023090530
item.description:
Report X-2023090530

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX WAS WET AT THE BOTTOM WHEN IT CAME DOWN BELT 1 LINE. WHEN HANDLER PICKED UP THE BOX, THE BOTTOM FELL OUT. ONE OF THE CANS BEGIN LEAKING REALLY BAD. QA WAS NEARBY; QUICKLY PUT ALL 6 CANS IN HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: ALL SIX CANS WERE DENTED. ONE OF THE CANS WERE LEAKING PROFUSELY WERE THE DENT WAS LOCATED AT THE BOTTOM OF THE CAN DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG WITH ABSORBENT INSIDE OF THE RED HAZMAT TOTE

item.title: Report X-2023090113
item.description:
Report X-2023090113

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During sort operations at the Memphis Hub a fiberboard box was dropped during the unloading process. The fiberboard box contained twelve glass bottles wrapped in bubble wrap and inside of plastic bags. One of the bottles inside was broken causing a release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for a new declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023090518
item.description:
Report X-2023090518

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-04T18:16:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: MOUNT JULIET
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED FROM TRAILER, SCANNED INTO THE BUILDING AND GLASS WAS HEARD RATTLING AS THE PACKAGE MOVED DOWN THE BELT. PACKAGE REMOVED, PLACED IN TOTE AND TAKEN TO QA DAMAGE AREA. DescribePack: GLASS BOTTLE INSIDE OUTER PACKING IS SMASHED. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE MOVED TO HAZMAT CAGE - HOWEVER OUTER CONTAINER WAS DRY BY THE TIME IT WAS RECEIVED AT ENAS.
